root.para: The auditor may find it useful to obtain an understanding of how the financial instruments relate to the fair value hierarchy. Ordinarily, the risk of material misstatement and the level of audit procedures to be applied increases as the level of measurement uncertainty increases. The use of Level 3 and some Level 2 inputs from the fair value hierarchy may be a useful guide to the level of measurement uncertainty. Level 2 inputs vary from those that are easily obtained to those that are closer to Level 3 inputs. The auditor evaluates available evidence and understands both the fair value hierarchy and the risk of management bias in managementâ€™s categorization of financial instruments in the fair value hierarchy.
